document.masterDocTitle: A new genus and two new species of Pudeoniscidae Lemos de Castro 1973 (Crustacea: Isopoda: Oniscidea) from Brazil

As mentioned by Lemos de Castro (1973) ,
P. birabeni
is the most common species of the genus and it is characterized by the dorsal surface densely covered by long triangular scale-setae giving a pilose aspect to the animal (see Figure 1 ). Both features were confirmed in this work. For a complete re-description, see Schmidt (2003) .
This species is recorded from Bahia, Rio de Janeiro, São Paulo, Paraná and Santa Catarina states. The present work considerably enlarges the distribution of the species ( Figure 14 (a).
